intro: Arenaria arcuatociliata, commonly known as the curved-haired sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is adapted to cold climates and is often found in high-altitude environments.
